awd_titl_txt: Gaseous Electronics Conference; Atlanta, Georgia;           October 13-16, 1987 (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: The conference deals with basic collisional, radiative, and             plasma processes important to the understanding of ionized gases.               Emphasis is given to the underlying electronic, ionic, atomic,                  and molecular processes that occur in electric discharges, arcs,                and gas lasers and to the relevant aspects of atomic and                        molecular structure, photon interactions, and plasma effects that               occur in discharges, arcs, and gas lasers.  The conference is a                 meeting for researchers working on processes important in                       discharges, arcs, and gas lasers, especially physicists,                        chemists, and engineers.  Academia, government, industry and                    national laboratories are well represented at this meeting.  The                program consists primarily of contributed papers together with                  workshops and invited papers on topics worthy of special                        interest.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
